intro: Mesembryanthemum recurvum, commonly known as the rock daisy, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, known for its succulent leaves and vibrant flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid environments. Its flowers are usually yellow or orange, and they open in response to sunlight. Mesembryanthemum recurvum is often cultivated for ornamental purposes due to its attractive appearance and hardy nature.
